EditText.android:text: The Android app "Unipi Audio Stories" was developed as part of a university project for the course of software enigineering for mobile devices. It offers a collection of engaging audio stories tailored for children. The app is designed to provide children with a delightful and educational experience through audio storytelling. It offers a curated selection of age-appropriate stories, ranging from classic fairy tales to modern adventures. Upon launching the app, children are greeted with a colorful and intuitive interface, designed to capture their attention and spark their imagination. The home screen presents a variety of available stories, allowing young listeners to explore tales based on their interests. Once a picture of a story is selected, the app is redirected to the media player and children are immersed in a captivating audio narrative, accompanied by details of the story. The app's user-friendly controls enable children to play, pause, and navigate between previous and next story. In addition to its diverse library of stories, "Unipi Audio Stories" offers a statistics panel where children can view how many times they've heard each story and which one is their most/least favorite.
